folder: Lafayette Street & Franklin Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Lafayette Street, east side, between Franklin and Leonard Streets. The view shows the Lafayette Street entrance to the City Prison, also known as "The Tombs".

About 1925.

folder: Lafayette Street & Franklin Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Lafayette Street, east side, south from but not including Franklin, to and including Leonard Streets. Also shown is Leonard Street, north side, east from Lafayette, to and including Centre Streets. This view shows The City Prison, known as "The Tombs" which name arose from its gloomy associations. Built in 1840.

About 1930.

Ewing Galloway.

folder: Lafayette Street & Franklin Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Lafayette Street, at the S.E. corner of Franklin Street, and showing The Tombs, a prison with its "Bridge of Sighs" connecting it to the Criminal Court Building; which is not shown, but would be on the extreme left. On the right appears a portion of the new Board of Health Building. Distinctly seen, under the afore mentioned "bridge" is the S.E. corner of Centre and Franklin Streets.

1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
reg. # 636

folder: Franklin Street & Lafayette Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Franklin Street (center to right), south side, west from Lafayette (left foreground) Street. The corner building bears No. 4 Franklin Street; the three 2 1/2 story structures between the Eagle Building (New York Telephone Company) and same, being No's 45 to 49 inclusive. The 2 story addition to the corner building is known as No. 64 Lafayette Street.

February 25, 1938.

P. L. Sperr.
